Text: Didn't work, i have put the file in the map and i can still only play Asian Dynasties. What have I done wrong?

doesn't work for me as well
I've put this into Age of empires 3 folder located in installation folder and run.
hey Anmisto, so where did you put the registry file? just in (C:\Program Files\Microsoft Games\ Age of Empires III) because it doesn't work for me as well.

Ok for those of you using windows 7 x64 I was able to get this working you have to right click and choose edit on the file when it opens change
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3 Expansion Pack 2\1.0] to [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3 Expansion Pack\1.0] basically you are adding Wow6432Node between software and Microsoft apparently windows 7 stores these keys in a different location.
I wish the game companies would come out with more rts games like this for the pc or 360.
WOW MAN . . .it WORKs PERFECTLY . . . !!!!!!!!!! win 7 32 bit lol
wooow!! tanxx a miilllll!! wrks gr8 for win.7

So it didn t work to me but i found a way to play warchiefs and tad togever.
1 st open a new text file with notepad and copy this one :

REG ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3\1.0" /v SetupPath /t REG_SZ /d "D:\Jeux\Age of Empires III\"
REG ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3\1.0" /v PID /t REG_SZ /d 77076-142-4072341-40812
REG ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3\1.0" /v CDPath /t REG_SZ /d L:\
REG ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3\1.0" /v CheckAccess /t REG_SZ /d 1
REG ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3\1.0" /v Version /t REG_SZ /d 1.12
REG ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3\1.0" /v DigitalProductID /t REG_BINARY /d 
REG ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3\1.0" /v LangID /t REG_DWORD /d 407
REG ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3 Expansion Pack\1.0" /v DigitalProductID /t REG_BINARY /d 
REG ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3 Expansion Pack\1.0" /v PID /t REG_SZ /d 77076-142-4072341-40812
REG ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3 Expansion Pack\1.0" /v DigitalProductID /t REG_BINARY /d 
REG ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Games\Age of Empires 3 Expansion Pack\1.0" /v PID /t REG_SZ /d 77076-142-4072341-40812

2 nd at 1st line u can read "D:\Jeux\Age of Empires III\" so change it for ur game location as exemple if ur game is in C:\Program Files\Microsoft Games\ Age of Empires III then change "D:\Jeux\Age of Empires III\" for "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Games\ Age of Empires III" BUT DON T FORGET THE "".
3rd save the file as for exemple patch.txt
4th rename the .txt by .bat so for exemple patch.bat
5 th launch it as administrator
6 th launch the asian dynasties it should work now for every windows versions
Excuse me for my bad english ^^

Works as intended, Windows 7 32bit, Just remember to "merge" it as the admin. It won't fully merge into registry from a limited account (no run-as admin unfortunately)
